page.title: 03THE COACH HOUSE EAST CARLTON
page.content: This building has been restored to its original appearance. It houses an Industrial Heritage Centre and Craft Workshops,with Parkland Information Centre,Visitors Information Centre and cafeteria.A display shows how iron ore was discovered in early times and how the local iron industry grew.Large exhibits together with reconstructions models,drawings,photographs and video film explain processes from quarrying to steel making and tube forming. The change from a rural area to a flourishing new town is recorded along with details of the lives of the people involved. The Coach House also provides visitors with a chance to see people working at traditional crafts and to purchase their individually made produce. Displays include glass blowing,copy painting and pine furniture making.
